means: （国王的）侍从，（贵族的）管家，收款人
张伯伦(姓氏； Arthur Neville, 1869-1940，英国政治家， 1937-1940年任首相； Sir Joseph Austen, 1863-1937，英国政治家，曾获1925年诺贝尔和平奖； Owen, 1920-，美国物理学

sentence.Network_en: Richard Chamberlain has agreed to make a sequel to "The Thorn Birds".
sentence.Network_cn: 理查德·张伯伦已经同意接拍《荆棘鸟》的续集。

sentence.Network_en: Chamberlain scored 50 or more points four times in the season.
sentence.Network_cn: 张伯伦在赛季中有4次得分不低于50。

sentence.Network_en: Chamberlain conceived the idea that the city hospital was badly managed.
sentence.Network_cn: 张伯伦认为城市的医院管理得非常糟.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a servant in a bedchamber): via Old French from Old Saxon kamera, from Latin camera 'vault' (see chamber)

entry.def: A chamberlain is the person who is in charge of the household affairs of a king, queen, or person of high social rank.

means.word_mean: 1. the treasurer of a municipal corporation
2. an officer who manages the household of a king or nobleman
